poem:
**Checkpoint**

with brash dark eyes  
they press questions—  
on the cold divide,  
voices that echo  
in the hollow  
of an airport's breath—  
each word a tether,  
each pause a leap  
over invisible walls,  
and the crowd  
moves on,  
papers in hand—  
like leaves  
drawn  
by an indifferent wind.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Don’t yap to cops’: why Hasan Piker’s US customs story kicked off a backlash When Hasan Piker was stopped and questioned about his political views by US Customs and Border Protection (CBP) agents at Chicago’s O’Hare airport last Sunday, the popular leftwing streamer thought he knew exactly what their motive was. “Obviously the reason for why they’re doing that is, I think, to try to create an environment of fear,” he told his legion of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
